snippet: In the shadow of the newly renovated Maracanã Stadium, where the World Cup final will be played, stands a crumbling building that was once devoted to the indigenous people of Brazil.
abstract: Aldeia Maracana, crumbling edifice that lies in the shadow of Rio de Janeiro's Maracana Stadium, has had a long and storied history; building has been a grand residence, a government office building, a museum dedicated to indigenous people, and a home to vagrants and squatters; was saved from planned demolition by protests as Brazil prepared for World Cup, and is now slated to be renovated and reopened as cultural center.
lead_paragraph: In the shadow of the newly renovated Maracanã Stadium, where the World Cup final will be played, stands a crumbling building that was once devoted to the indigenous people of Brazil.

headline.seo: In Shadow of Brazil World Cup’s Premier Stadium, a Hulking Ruin
